pullRequest.body:
Part of #15524. This adds basic definitions for the `coheight`, and then
analogous lemmas for every lemma about `height`. Due to the way
`coheight` is defined, most lemmas are defeq to the corresponding lemma
bout `height` in the dual order.

From the Carleson project.

You can run this locally as

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

```suggestion
lemma coheight_eq_iSup_head_eq (a : α) :
```

```suggestion
lemma coheight_eq_coe_add_one_iff {x : α} {n : ℕ} :
```

```suggestion
lemma coheight_eq_coe_iff {x : α} {n : ℕ} :
```

```suggestion
lemma coheight_eq_coe_iff_maximal_le_coheight {a : α} {n : ℕ} :
```

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma height_toDual (x : α) : height (toDual x) = coheight x := rfl
@[simp] lemma height_ofDual (x : αᵒᵈ) : height (ofDual x) = coheight x := rfl
@[simp] lemma coheight_toDual (x : α) : coheight (toDual x) = height x := rfl
@[simp] lemma coheight_ofDual (x : αᵒᵈ) : coheight (ofDual x) = height x := rfl
```

```suggestion
lemma coheight_anti : Antitone (α := α) coheight :=
```

```suggestion
  height_mono.dual_left
```
might work

Unfortunately doesn’t:
```
synthesized type class instance is not definitionally equal to expression inferred by typing rules, synthesized
  inst✝
inferred
  OrderDual.instPreorder α
```
And instantiating `α` gives
```
type mismatch
  Monotone.dual_left height_mono
has type
  Antitone (height ∘ ⇑OrderDual.ofDual) : Prop
but is expected to have type
  Antitone coheight : Prop
```
which doesn’t seem to line up, not sure why exactly.

Is it DefEq abuse to just use `a` at type `αᵒᵈ`, as in the definition of
```
noncomputable def coheight {α : Type*} [Preorder α] (a : α) : ℕ∞ := height (α := αᵒᵈ) a
```

> And instantiating `α` gives

Do you mean
```
height_mono (α := α).dual_left
```
? because the right thing would be
```
height_mono (α := αᵒᵈ).dual_left
```
Ah, yes, that may explain my failure. I'll try!

```suggestion
lemma length_le_coheight_head {p : LTSeries α} : p.length ≤ coheight p.head :=
```
... unless I've lost my last, hmm head
No, certainly my mind that got lost at some point here :-)

```suggestion
lemma rev_index_le_coheight (p : LTSeries α) (i : Fin (p.length + 1)) : i.rev ≤ coheight (p i) := by
```
maybe?

```suggestion
lemma coheight_le_coheight_apply_of_strictMono (f : α → β) (hf : StrictMono f) (x : α) :
```

```suggestion
lemma coheight_eq_iSup_gt_coheight (x : α) : coheight x = ⨆ y > x, coheight y + 1 :=
```

```suggestion
    n < coheight x ↔ ∃ y > x, coheight y = n :=
```
(Personally, I’d be inclined to ban omitting parenthesis on the right of a symmetric operator when you cannot omit them on the left.)

pullRequest.title: feat(KrullDimension): coheight API
